items.name: Poké Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon.

items.name: Great Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by 5.

items.name: Ultra Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by 10.

items.name: Master Ball
description: Lets a trainer automatically succeed on a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon.

items.name: Safari Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by your Nature skill modifier.

items.name: Fast Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Can throw as a reaction to a fleeing Pokémon.

items.name: Level Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 5 if your trainer level is higher than the target Pokémon's level.

items.name: Lure Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 if used while fishing.

items.name: Heavy Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 if the target Pokémon is size medium or larger.

items.name: Love Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by twice your active Pokémon's Charisma modifier.

items.name: Friend Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by your Persuasion skill modifier.

items.name: Moon Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 against Pokémon that can evolve using a Moon Stone.

items.name: Sport Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by your Athletics skill modifier.

items.name: Net Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 against Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.

items.name: Dive Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 while underwater.

items.name: Nest Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 5 if target Pokémon is level 5 or lower.

items.name: Repeat Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 against a species you have already caught before.

items.name: Timer Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. When you use the Throw Pokéball action, you may instead hold the ball and start concentrating. At a later round, when you throw the ball, reduce the capture DC by 1 for each turn spent concentrating, to a max of 10.

items.name: Luxury Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Pokémon residing in a Luxury Ball gain +1 to their max hit dice.

items.name: Premier Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Rare, and often considered a token of class.

items.name: Dusk Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce capture DC by 10 while at night or in darkness.

items.name: Heal Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. When the Pokémon in the Heal Ball spends a hit die during a short rest, it may roll twice and take the higher result.

items.name: Quick Ball
description: Lets a trainer attempt a Capture Roll to catch a Pokémon. Reduce the capture DC by 8 if used during the first round of combat.

items.name: Dream Ball
description: Reduce the capture DC by 5 if used on a Pokémon affected by the Sleep condition.

items.name: Potion
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 2d4 + 2 HP to an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Super Potion
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 3d6 + 6 HP to an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Hyper Potion
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 4d12 + 10 HP to an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Antidote
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of the Poisoned or Badly Poisoned conditions. Consumed on use.

items.name: Burn Heal
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of the Burned condition. Consumed on use.

items.name: Ice Heal
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of the Frozen condition. Consumed on use.

items.name: Awakening
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of the Asleep condition. Consumed on use.

items.name: Paralyze Heal
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of the Paralysis condition. Consumed on use.

items.name: Max Potion
description: A trainer may use an action to administor this medicine to an adjacent Pokémon. 10 minutes after consumption, the Pokémon regains 70 HP. Consumed on use.

items.name: Full Heal
description: A trainer may use an action to administor this medicine to an adjacent Pokémon. 10 minutes after consumption, the Pokémon is cured of all status conditions. Consumed on use.

items.name: Full Restore
description: A trainer may use an action to administor this medicine to an adjacent Pokémon. 10 minutes after consumption, the Pokémon regains 70 HP and is cured of all status conditions. Consumed on use.

items.name: Revive
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 2d4 + 2 HP to a fainted Pokémon in a Pokéball. Consumed on use.

items.name: Max Revive
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 4d12 + 10 HP to a fainted Pokémon in a Pokéball. Consumed on use.

items.name: Fresh Water
description: When consumed, restores 7 HP. A trainer may use a bonus action to consume this item, or a full action to administer it to an adjacent Pokémon.

items.name: Soda Pop
description: When consumed, restores 15 HP. A trainer may use a bonus action to consume this item, or a full action to administer it to an adjacent Pokémon.

items.name: Berry Juice
description: When consumed, restores 20 HP. A trainer may use a bonus action to consume this item, or a full action to administer it to an adjacent Pokémon.

items.name: Lemonade
description: When consumed, restores 30 HP. A trainer may use a bonus action to consume this item, or a full action to administer it to an adjacent Pokémon.

items.name: Moomoo Milk
description: When consumed, restores 50 HP. A trainer may use a bonus action to consume this item, or a full action to administer it to an adjacent Pokémon.

items.name: Energy Powder
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 3d6 + 6 HP to an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use. Most Pokémon dislike Energy Powder, so overuse may result in loss of bond.

items.name: Energy Root
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 4d12 + 10 HP to an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use. Most Pokémon dislike Energy Root, so overuse may result in loss of bond.

items.name: Heal Powder
description: A trainer may use an action to cure an adjacent Pokémon of all status conditions. Consumed on use. Most Pokémon dislike Heal Powder, so overuse may result in loss of bond.

items.name: Revival Herb
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 4d12 + 10 HP to a fainted Pokémon in a Pokéball. Consumed on use. Most Pokémon dislike Revival Herbs, so overuse may result in loss of bond.

items.name: Ether
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 5 PP to a single move of an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Max Ether
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 10 PP to a single moves of an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Elixir
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 5 PP to all moves of an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Max Elixir
description: A trainer may use an action to restore 10 PP to all moves of an adjacent Pokémon. Consumed on use.

items.name: Sacred Ash
description: A trainer may spend 5 minutes to revive up to six fainted Pokémon. Each Pokémon revived this way is restored to half their max HP.

items.name: HP Up
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's max HP is increased by 5. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Protein
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's STR score is increased by 1. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Iron
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's CON score is increased by 1. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Carbos
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's DEX score is increased by 1. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Calcium
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's WIS score is increased by 1. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Zinc
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 8 hours, that Pokémon's CHA score is increased by 1. Consumed on use.
This is a vitamin. Pokémon may only benefit from the effects of one vitamin at a time.

items.name: Guard Spec
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon cannot be affected by new status conditions.

items.name: Dire Hit
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon's critical hit range increases by one.
Most of the time, this means attacks can critical on a natural 19 or 20. For a move like Slash which already expands crticial hit range, criticals can happen on natural 18, 19, or 20.

items.name: X Attack
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon adds +2 to their attack rolls.

items.name: X Defense
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon adds +2 to AC.

items.name: X Speed
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon's movement speed is increased by 10ft.

items.name: X Accuracy
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. The Pokémon gains advantage on its next three attack rolls.

items.name: X Sp. Atk
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon adds +2 to its Move DC.

items.name: X Sp. Def
description: A trainer may use an action to administer this to a Pokémon. For 1 minute, that Pokémon adds +2 to saving throws.

items.name: Ability Capsule
items._ingameEffect: Switches a Pokémon between its two possible (non-Hidden) Abilities.

items.name: Health Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's HP effort by 1.

items.name: Muscle Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Attack effort by 1.

items.name: Resist Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Defense effort by 1.

items.name: Genius Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Special Attack effort by 1.

items.name: Clever Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Special Defense effort by 1.

items.name: Swift Feather
items._ingameEffect:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Speed effort by 1.

items.name: Sun Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Moon Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Fire Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Thunder Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Water Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Leaf Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Shiny Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Dusk Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Dawn Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Ice Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Oval Stone
description: Some Pokémon may consume the power of this stone to evolve.

items.name: Cheri Berry
description: Consume to cure paralysis. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming paralyzed.

items.name: Chesto Berry
description: Consume to cure sleep. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming asleep.

items.name: Pecha Berry
description: Consume to cure poison. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming poisoned or badly poisoned.

items.name: Rawst Berry
description: Consume to cure burn. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming burned.

items.name: Aspear Berry
description: Consume to cure freeze. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming frozen.

items.name: Leppa Berry
description: Consume to restore 3 PP to a move. Can be consumed as a reaction to a move reaching 0 PP.

items.name: Oran Berry
description: Consume to restore 2d4 + 2 HP. Can be consumed as a reaction to dropping below half health.

items.name: Persim Berry
description: Consume to cure confusion. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming confused.

items.name: Lum Berry
description: Consume to cure any single status condition. Can be consumed as a reaction to becoming being afflicted with a status condition.

items.name: Sitrus Berry
description: Consume to restore 30 HP. Can be consumed as a reaction to dropping below half health.

items.name: Occa Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking fire-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Passho Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking water-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Wacan Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking electric-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Rindo Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking grass-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Yache Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking ice-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Chople Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking fighting-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Kebia Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking poison-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Shuca Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking ground-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Coba Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking flying-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Payapa Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking psychic-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Tanga Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking bug-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Charti Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking rock-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Kasib Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking ghost-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Haban Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking dragon-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Colbur Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking dark-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Babiri Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking steel-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Chilan Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking normal-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Roseli Berry
description: Can be consumed as a reaction to taking fairy-type damage. You take half that damage instead.

items.name: Absorb Bulb
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   When the holder takes water-type damage from a move, its Special Attack rises by one stage and this item is consumed.

items.name: Air Balloon
description: The holder is immune to ground-type damage. When the holder takes damage, the item is popped and no longer confers its benefit.
The Air Balloon can be freely repaired during a short rest.

items.name: Assault Vest
description: The holder has +1 to their AC, but may only use damaging moves.

items.name: Big Root
description: Moves that simultaneously deal damage to a target and heal the holder restore an additional 1d12 HP to the holder.

items.name: Binding Band
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   Moves used by the holder that trap and damage a target for multiple turns (e.g. bind, fire spin) inflict twice their usual per-turn damage.

items.name: Black Sludge
description: This item has 10 charges. If the holder is a poison-type Pokémon, they may use a bonus action to use a charge, healing HP equal to their proficiency bonus.
If the holder is not a poison-type Pokémon, they take 1d6 poison damage at the end of each of their turns.

items.name: Bright Powder
items._ingameEffect:
Held in battle
:   Moves targeting the holder have 0.9× chance to hit.

items.name: Cell Battery
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   When the holder takes electric-type damage from a move, its Attack rises by one stage and this item is consumed.

items.name: Destiny Knot
items._ingameEffect: Held: When the holder becomes Attracted, the Pokémon it is Attracted to becomes Attracted back.

items.name: Eject Button
description: This item has 1 charge. When the holder is damaged by an attack, its trainer may perform a single Switch as a free action, consuming the charge.
The Eject Button regains its charge at dawn each day.

items.name: Eviolite
description: The holder is prevented from evolving. If the Pokémon holding this is not a final evolutionary form, they take 3 less damage from all damage sources.

items.name: Expert Belt
items._ingameEffect: Held: When the holder hits with a super-effective move, its power is raised by 20%.

items.name: Float Stone
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   Holder has 0.5× weight.

items.name: Focus Band
description: When the holder would become flinched, roll a d20. On a 10 or higher, the holder does not flinch.

items.name: Focus Sash
description: This item has 1 charge. If damage would bring the holder to below 1 HP, it instead brings the holder to 1 HP, consuming the charge.
The Focus Sash regains its charge at dawn each day.

items.name: Grip Claw
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the duration of the holder's multiturn (2-5 turn) moves by three turns.

items.name: Leftovers
description: This item has 10 charges. The holder may use a bonus action to use a charge, healing HP equal to their proficiency bonus.

items.name: Luminous Moss
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder is hit by a damaging Water move, it consumes this item and raises its Special Defense by one stage.

items.name: King’s Rock
description: When a target is hit by a melee attack made by the holder, the target must make a CON save, flinching on failure. The DC is equal to 8 + half the holder's level.

items.name: Lagging Tail
items._ingameEffect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.

items.name: Light Clay
items._ingameEffect: Held: The holder's Reflect and Light Screen will create effects lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the barrier itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.

items.name: Metronome
items._ingameEffect: Held: Each time the holder uses the same move consecutively, its power is increased by another 10% of its original, to a maximum of 100%.

items.name: Muscle Band
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to damage it deals from melee attacks (once per move).

items.name: Protective Pads
items._ingameEffect: Held: Prevents side effects of contact moves used on the holder.

items.name: Quick Claw
description: The holder adds +3 to their initiative rolls.

items.name: Razor Claw
description: The holder's critical hit range increases by one.
Most of the time, this means attacks can critical on a natural 19 or 20. For a move like Slash which already expands crticial hit range, criticals can happen on natural 18, 19, or 20.

items.name: Razor Fang
items._ingameEffect:
Held: When the holder attacks with most damaging moves, provides an extra 11.7% (30/256) chance for the target to flinch.
Held by Gligar: Evolves the holder into Gliscor when it levels up.

items.name: Red Card
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   When the holder takes damage directly from a move and does not faint, it switches out for another random, non-fainted Pokémon in its party.
This effect does not activate if another effect prevents the holder from switching out.

items.name: Ring Target
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   When one of the user's types would render it immune to damage, that type is ignored for damage calculation.

items.name: Rocky Helmet
items._ingameEffect:
Held
:   When the holder is hit by a contact move, the attacking Pokémon takes 1/6 its max HP in damage.

items.name: Safety Goggles
items._ingameEffect: Held: Prevents damage from powder moves and the damage from Hail and Sandstorm.

items.name: Scope Lens
description: The holder's critical hit range increases by one.
Most of the time, this means attacks can critical on a natural 19 or 20. For a move like Slash which already expands crticial hit range, criticals can happen on natural 18, 19, or 20.

items.name: Shed Shell
items._ingameEffect: Held: The holder is unaffected by any moves or abilities that would prevent it from actively leaving battle.

items.name: Shell Bell
description: When the holder uses a move that damages at least one creature, the holder restores HP equal to its proficiency bonus.

items.name: Smoke Ball
description: Guarantees a success in an attempt to flee from wild Pokémon battles.

items.name: Snowball
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder is hit by a damaging Ice move, raises its Attack by one stage.

items.name: Sticky Barb
items._ingameEffect: Held: Damaged the holder for 1/8 its max HP.  When the holder is struck by a contact move, damages the attacker for 1/8 its max HP; if the attacker is not holding an item, it will take this item.

items.name: Weakness Policy
items._ingameEffect: Held: When the holder is hit by a super effective move, its Attack and Special Attack raise by two stages.

items.name: Wide Lens
description: The holder gains +1 to attack rolls.

items.name: Wise Glasses
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to damage it deals from ranged attacks (once per move).

items.name: Zoom Lens
items._ingameEffect:
Held: Raises the holder's Accuracy by 20% when it goes last.
Ingame description is incorrect.

items.name: Megalite Stone
description: Allows the Pokémon holding this to Mega Evolve. Has one charge, and recovers its charge at dawn each day.

items.name: Z-Crystal
description: Allows the Pokémon holding this to use a Z-Move. Has one charge, and recovers its charge at dawn each day.

items.name: Mental Herb
items._ingameEffect:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is attracted, it consumes this item to cure the attraction.

items.name: Power Herb
items._ingameEffect: Held: Whenever the holder uses a move that requires a turn to charge first (Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Razor Wind, Skull Bash, Sky Attack, or Solarbeam), this item is consumed and the charge is skipped.  Skull Bash still provides a Defense boost.

items.name: White Herb
items._ingameEffect:
Held in battle
:   At the end of each turn, if any of the holder's stats have a negative stat modifier, the holder consumes this item to remove the modifiers from those stats.

items.name: Choice Band
items._ingameEffect:
Held in battle
:   Holder has 1.5× its Attack.  When the holder attempts to use a move, all its other moves are disabled until it leaves battle or loses this item.

    The restriction ends even if this item is swapped for another Choice item
via trick or switcheroo.

items.name: Choice Scarf
items._ingameEffect:
Held: Increases the holder's Speed by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

items.name: Choice Specs
items._ingameEffect:
Held: Increases the holder's Special Attack by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)

items.name: Black Belt
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to fighting-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Black Glasses
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to dark-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Charcoal
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to fire-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Dragon Fang
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to dragon-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Fairy Feather
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to fairy-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Hard Stone
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to rock-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Magnet
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to electric-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Metal Coat
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to steel-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Miracle Seed
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to grass-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Mystic Water
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to water-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Never-Melt Ice
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to ice-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Poison Barb
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to poison-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Sharp Beak
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to flying-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Silk Scarf
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to normal-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Silver Powder
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to bug-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Soft Sand
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to ground-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Spell Tag
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to ghost-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Twisted Spoon
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to psychic-type damage it deals (once per move).

items.name: Full Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.

items.name: Lax Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the holder's Evasion by 5%.

items.name: Odd Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Psychic moves by 20%.

items.name: Rock Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.

items.name: Rose Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.

items.name: Sea Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.

items.name: Wave Incense
items._ingameEffect: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.

items.name: Adrenaline Orb
items._ingameEffect: Makes wild Pokémon more likely to summon allies.  Held: increases the holder's Speed by one stage when affected by Intimidate.

items.name: Flame Orb
description: At the end of the holder's turn, the holder becomes burned.

items.name: Iron Ball
items._ingameEffect: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  If the holder is Flying or has Levitate, it takes regular damage from Ground attacks and is suspectible to Spikes and Toxic Spikes.

items.name: Life Orb
description: The holder adds its proficiency bonus to damage it deals, but takes the same amount of typeless-damage each time.

items.name: Toxic Orb
description: At the end of the holder's turn, the holder becomes badly poisoned.

items.name: Damp Rock
description: The holder increases the duration of their Rain effects by 3 rounds.

items.name: Heat Rock
description: The holder increases the duration of their Harsh Sunlight effects by 3 rounds.

items.name: Icy Rock
description: The holder increases the duration of their Hail and Snow effects by 3 rounds.

items.name: Smooth Rock
description: The holder increases the duration of their Sandstorm effects by 3 rounds.

items.name: Terrain Extender
items._ingameEffect: Held: When the holder changes the Terrain (whether by move or ability), it will last  8 turns instead of 5.

items.name: Electric Seed
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder enters battle during Electric Terrain, or if Electric Terrain is activated while the holder is in battle, this item is consumed and the holder's Defense raises by one stage.

items.name: Grassy Seed
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder enters battle during Grassy Terrain, or if Grassy Terrain is activated while the holder is in battle, this item is consumed and the holder's Defense raises by one stage.

items.name: Misty Seed
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder enters battle during Misty Terrain, or if Misty Terrain is activated while the holder is in battle, this item is consumed and the holder's Special Defense raises by one stage.

items.name: Psychic Seed
items._ingameEffect: Held: If the holder enters battle during Psychic Terrain, or if Psychic Terrain is activated while the holder is in battle, this item is consumed and the holder's Special Defense raises by one stage.

items.name: Arceus Plate
description: Changes the typing of Arceus and the move Judgement. Comes in 18 varieties, one for each pokémon type.
